metadata.name: token_haver
metadata.description: SPL Governance plugin granting governance power based on the nonzero presence of locked tokens

accounts.name: registrar
docs: The Registrar for the given realm and governing_token_mint

accounts.name: realm_authority
docs: Authority of the Realm must sign and match realm.authority

accounts.name: registrar
docs: The Realm Voter Registrar
There can only be a single registrar per governance Realm and governing mint of the Realm

accounts.name: governance_program_id
docs: The program id of the spl-governance program the realm belongs to

accounts.name: realm
docs: An spl-governance Realm
Realm is validated in the instruction:
- Realm is owned by the governance_program_id
- governing_token_mint must be the community or council mint
- realm_authority is realm.authority

accounts.name: governing_token_mint
docs: Either the realm community mint or the council mint.
It must match Realm.community_mint or Realm.config.council_mint
Note: Once the Realm voter plugin is enabled the governing_token_mint is used only as identity
for the voting population and the tokens of that are no longer used

accounts.name: realm_authority
docs: realm_authority must sign and match Realm.authority

accounts.name: registrar
docs: The RealmVoter voting Registrar

errors.name: TokenAccountWrongOwner
errors.msg: All token accounts must be owned by the governing token owner

errors.name: TokenAccountWrongMint
errors.msg: All token accounts' mints must be included in the registrar

errors.name: TokenAccountNotLocked
errors.msg: All token accounts must be locked

errors.name: TokenAccountDuplicateMint
errors.msg: All token accounts' mints must be unique

types.name: Registrar
docs: Registrar which stores spl-governance configurations for the given Realm

fields.name: governance_program_id
docs: spl-governance program the Realm belongs to

fields.name: realm
docs: Realm of the Registrar

fields.name: governing_token_mint
docs: Governing token mint the Registrar is for
It can either be the Community or the Council mint of the Realm
When the plugin is enabled the mint is only used as the identity of the governing power (voting population)
and the actual token of the mint is not used

types.name: VoterWeightAction
docs: VoterWeightAction enum as defined in spl-governance-addin-api
It's redefined here for Anchor to export it to IDL

types.name: VoterWeightRecord
docs: VoterWeightRecord account as defined in spl-governance-addin-api
It's redefined here without account_discriminator for Anchor to treat it as native account
The account is used as an api interface to provide voting power to the governance program from external addin contracts

fields.name: realm
docs: The Realm the VoterWeightRecord belongs to

fields.name: governing_token_mint
docs: Governing Token Mint the VoterWeightRecord is associated with
Note: The addin can take deposits of any tokens and is not restricted to the community or council tokens only

fields.name: governing_token_owner
docs: The owner of the governing token and voter
This is the actual owner (voter) and corresponds to TokenOwnerRecord.governing_token_owner

fields.name: voter_weight
docs: Voter's weight
The weight of the voter provided by the addin for the given realm, governing_token_mint and governing_token_owner (voter)

fields.name: voter_weight_expiry
docs: The slot when the voting weight expires
It should be set to None if the weight never expires
If the voter weight decays with time, for example for time locked based weights, then the expiry must be set
As a common pattern Revise instruction to update the weight should be invoked before governance instruction within the same transaction
and the expiry set to the current slot to provide up to date weight

fields.name: weight_action
docs: The governance action the voter's weight pertains to
It allows to provided voter's weight specific to the particular action the weight is evaluated for
When the action is provided then the governance program asserts the executing action is the same as specified by the addin

fields.name: weight_action_target
docs: The target the voter's weight  action pertains to
It allows to provided voter's weight specific to the target the weight is evaluated for
For example when addin supplies weight to vote on a particular proposal then it must specify the proposal as the action target
When the target is provided then the governance program asserts the target is the same as specified by the addin

fields.name: reserved
docs: Reserved space for future versions
